newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Petronas chief says Tapis crude prices to stay hig.
newsitem.headline: Petronas chief says Tapis crude prices to stay hig.

text.p: Malaysian Tapis crude oil prices are likely to remain high until March, Hassan Marican, the president of Malaysia's state-run oil company Petroliam Nasional Bhd (Petronas) said on Friday.
"The present high level of prices will continue to exist in the very short term," he said. When asked to clarify the time frame, he added: "Until March."
On Monday, Petronas raised its December-lifting Tapis crude oil price to $25.44 per barrel, up 38 cents from 25.06 in November.
Hassan attributed the high price to low stock levels worldwide and a severe winter in Europe and parts of the U.S.
Hassan said he expected the price to taper off to a more realistic level when the current demand eases.
The supply of crude oil from Iraq as part of an oil for food deal in 1996 had already been factored into the price, Hassan said.
